characterDescription: Tress is an actual person from the cosmere, about whom Hoid tells a tale, and her world is an actual place. Neither are Hoid's inventions. He takes a few liberties in the narrative, but - according to Brandon - mostly, this is canon.

characterDetails.Appearance: Tress has unruly,* light brown hair that she wears in a braid tied with a ribbon. Still, some strands always find a way to escape and wave free in the wind.
characterDetails.History: Tress is on a world that involves the aethers tangentially, though not the main, core aethers.
characterDetails.Characteristics:
She is overly fond of collecting cups.
She wonders why men so often use food to describe women’s features.
characterDetails.Character: She has been raised to posses a certain inalienable pragmatism.
characterDetails.Notes:
Originally named Glorf upon her birth (a family name), her wild hair earned her the name of Tress.
*In her estimation, her hair's unruliness is its most interesting trait. Further, that  this wild hair had earned her the above moniker, again in her estimation, is her most interesting feature.
